status_message:
OPEN LETTER TO PIE NTAVYOHANYAMA
Pie,
The chickens have indeed come  to roost ; if not to toot  loudly , in  a more than ” justice coming down like mighty waters “  crackling scenario, that  I would have not  normally expected ,upon your person, as a  one time  despots’  quasi immunity beneficiary .
How you    became fugitive -Pie Ntavyohanyuma -  now  holed up in Belgium ,in fear of Piere Nkuruziza your  master of many years ,  beats me. 
If  you now  find yourself suddenly  truer to the tenets of democracy and sanctity of human life,  while sitting  almost uneasily on a couch in your nest of refuge in Belgium; do me a favour and think back on the afternoon of  the 21st April,2005.
 When you had  lent your person to the final  act of the execution of  Ambassador Bavumile.H.Vilakazi  then  High Commissioner to Uganda representing  South Africa ,to complete a well planned assassination of your victim ,whose victimhood  roots of the  plot to eliminate him, you might not even have understood .
 As they had then  stretched ,far deeper than his representativeness  of a government that very badly, needed to dissuade Nkuruziza from  doing exactly what he is doing now ; for his political party to be granted more hegemonic clout than all the rest in Burundi, with a  forcefully abetment  of  Yuveri  Museveni of Uganda and as a result Bavumile’s  government not abusing him only fully, but throwing him  like a sacrificial piece of meat   into the deep  of your masters snarling hunger for total  feudalist and  hegemonic power in the Great Lakes.
While Bavumile’s assassination has been denuded to have included  ritual murder  to clearly  benefit the Ugandans, with its then minister of health leading the pack,  fully indulging in  the   further dismemberment and harvesting  of his  remains’ orgy.
Only an international commission of inquiry will one day reveal as to how much the likes of you, Nkuruziza, Mbeki and Zuma stood to gain from his stolen body parts. Unless you beat your masters to it, by summoning  some guts and revealing all..
 By the way, Pie ,you have been openly indicted by a Mr Jan Tobias Vermaak a the manager in Bavumile’s office in Kampala , as the henchman that finished off my brother-he spelled out a very graphic way in which you induced the final heart seizure of  the  already badly physically battered heart of my brother -not only that -but how  Vermaak was  personally was armed with the knowledge of the state of his heart, and voluntarily  implicating himself extensively in the plot , as he nevertheless  paradoxically relates  Bavumile’s  last minutes in your hands Pie- very tearfully, whenever he has had an opportunity to relate it ... 
There was a bigger plot but you pulled the trigger Pie. You did it clearly, what ever the  other source  of   a sub-plot , directly under the instruction of Nkuruziza  entailed .
On the following day,  the 22nd April,2005,you and many principals out of Africa celebrated the signing of some pseudo Peace Agreement  dripping deep in my brother’s blood, but not even the least Zuma, did  even  in a whisper  acknowledge my brother’s death that occurred the previous afternoon , at your hands ; to the delegation of excellencies assembling at Entebbe .
Not one media in your country Burundi  mentioned the tragic passing of my brother ,on the following day  and subsequent days ,weeks and months ,as your assassinations  hands would have been  exposed.
Now as you shed off yourself , the apron strings of Nkuruziza and the Lordship of Museveni, is it  not time to come clean to  the world, as to  why my brother was killed and how the Peace Summit of the 22nd April 2005, was Africa’s greatest fuss and a Zuma/South Africa “Victory Lie’’ of all time ,now once more exposed by  the real  McCoy Nkuruziza true to form ,shedding more blood for more power...
Your great moment of grace is facing you in the  eye, seize it and tell the truth about the Nkuruziza, Museveni, Mbeki and Zuma  plot over my brother’s assassination now that you are  well protected from them .
I don’t have the luxury of being  ensconced  in some  Belgian  safe- house, I remain forever exposed to harm and even assassination ; but you don’t now , -you can come clean ...
You are now, no more not  protected and tainted by  the so called  diplomatic   immunities ditched out by despotic  butchers of  Africans by unqualified  visionless  African  wannabe rulers ,dripping with rivers of our blood...
Should by any chance ,my well sourced  allegations ,  having been kept from you , you now can read all about your indictment in my brother’s death in the book published online by Amazon, entitled : ‘YERSTERDAY IS NOT GONE... by Paul Njabulo  Villakazi
Go ahead   make a clean breast of it all, unless you are just a died in the wool , mean spirited  agent,  being paid by other forces going this time  around  against Nkuruziza . 
Being no clean refugee  but just another African scum . Come un,  do the best ever ; for  history the  African continent’s future   and yourself. 
I  will appreciate any feed back on my email address: oupaswazi@yahoo.com or my facebook account :Paul Njabulo Vilakazi
I thank you
Paul Njabulo Vilakazi

status_message:
BIG BUSINESS CAN'T BE ENRICHED AT MY EXPENSE!

Today under the spotlight is Finrite volume insurance administrator which handles cell-phone insurance for Hollard Insurance. 

i bought Samsung galaxy S4 in 2014 and took out insurance on  it for R130 per month as premiums. A year and four months later i realized that they're they're debiting two premiums from my bank account.

i immediately alerted them and requested a refund, which they indicated that they'll investigate and i should expect the refund in the bank within seven days. This did not happen.

I've called Finrite offices on numerous occasions, only to be subjected to a machines wasting my airtime, and incompetent consultants that could not assist me appropriately. I've complained to hollard consultants at Game stores and  also called Hollard Insurance both keep referring me to Finrite instead of helping to get the matter resolved.  

It's now five weeks and still have not received that important SMS from the bank and want to take Hollard Insurance and Finrite on.

I've seems cancelled my insurance without a sore heart, and now in the market to get another insurance. Any recommendations? 

WHEN ARE YOU GOING TO PAY BACK THE MONEY? 
PAY BACK THE MONEY!! PAY BACK THE MONEY!!

ADVICE TO HOLLARD INSURANCE: PLEASE RECONSIDER FINRITE AND CHECK THAT THEY'RE REPRESENTING YOU WELL, YOU LOST A CLIENT DUE TO POOR SERVICE AND DON'T TAKE THIS LIGTHLY.

Please like and share

1. IF a company has unlawfully been stealing your money through unauthorized debits
2. IF you believe that the impersonal machines that answer phones at these big companies waste our your airtime.

WE MUST SPEAK OUT OR BIG BUSINESS WILL KEEP TREATING THE PUBLIC WITH CONTEMPT!!!

Second Chance Recovery Center (SCRC), is a Non-Profit organization based in the heart of Mamelodi West, east of Pretoria. The centre will be hosting The ‘’Hike Against Drug Abuse” campaign on the 20th June 2015 from 6:30 – 14:00 @ (3955 Dr. Ribane Street, Mamelodi West). The Drug campaign was introduced in 2012 since its inception, the campaign has been receiving great support from the South African Police Service (SAPS), Vodacom, Department of Social Development, Tshwane MMC, Mams Radio, The DailySun Newspaper etc. 

The campaign is aimed at creating awareness on the dangers of drug abuse amongst the youth. We would like to invite your editor or journalist to be part of the campaign in honor of your presence and support towards Second Chance Recovery Center’s 4th Annual Hike Against Drug Abuse.

Thank you!

status_message:
Where are your proofreaders?? I have noticed a distressing increase in typographical errors and  errors of basic grammar and syntax in your paper.
This was on page 11 in yesterday's issue, under the headline  "Bush begins race for the White House :  While White House hopeful Jeb Bush makes his candidacy official today after he has run a de facto race for six months, one that has yet to meet backers' high hopes.
That is meaningless. It's NOT a sentence. Surely somebody checks what your journalists write!

An environmental assessment at a downtown Kimberley warehouse uncovered a secret stash of plastic buckets and bags containing rotting body parts, foetuses and placentas collected from state hospitals and clinics in the Northern Cape province. The buckets stood in haphazard stacks in the incubator-like heat generated by the hot zinc roof. Some of the lids had popped off the buckets, unable to contain the build-up of micro-organisms within. Foul fluids oozed from some of the bags and ran in sticky rivulets across the concrete floor; the results of a medical waste tender awarded to Tshenolo Resources, a company owned by Thami Wandile Bozwana, a corrupt ex - government official turned tenderpreneur. Its quite disturbing how much influence bribery has in SA that people are willing to violate and neglect health regulations all for the sake of greed...this is the kind of behaviour that will lead to the destruction of the youth of this country as it sets a very wrong path for them. The youth of Kurumani doesn't need such role models! #saynotocorruption#happyyouthday

I have received many PM's asking me to translate the article about Facebook slander in today's edition of the Afrikaans newspaper "Beeld."

For those that are unable to understand the article from the Afrikaans newspaper I have tried to translate it Via Google Translate, here are the results:

A Welkom businessman with interests in Mozambique has received a preliminary injunction from the Free State High Court to prohibit any information about him and his immediate family being placed on Facebook or other social media place.

Carlos Carvalho of Maputo was also ordered by the order to immediately remove all information about Kobus Claassen and his family from his Facebook group and other social media.

Claassen sought this order after defamatory allegations were made by Carvalho on Facebook.

The order will be personally served on Carvalho, who has dual Mozambican and South African citizenship, it will also be sent to him by e-mail and It will also be placed on a Facebok group.

He has 30 days to oppose the preliminary injunction.

Claassen said in a statement before Acting Judge NM Mbhele he and Carvalho are both in tourism in Mozambique and are also both regular users of Facebook and involved in Facebook groups.

He said he was a regular visitor to Mozambique and his son, Jacques, a 80% stake in a company that owns a guesthouse there.

Claassen says he himself has invested money in the company to buy property.

On 23 September last year and regularly thereafter Carvalho on the Facebook page Moz I remarks on especially South Africans that put to him questions on the group

According to Carvalho wanted these people to let water their boats in Matolorivier the payment of port inspections and other fees to escape.

Claassen said following Carvalho's persistent remarks about South African tourists he answered him on 24 October.

Carvalho apparently disliked it, and went out of his way to set him in a bad light, said Claassen.

They attacked each other over and over again on Facebook.

Claassen said he said nothing derogatory about Carvalho.

What Carvalho said, comes down to him saying that Claassen has a bad character, cheat, breaking the law and stupid.

Eventually through the mediation of someone else on May 19 the two decided to sign an agreement that they will stop making comments about each other on Facebook.

Claassen signed it the next day. Until now Carvalho have not signed and meanwhile he again made comments about Claassen on Facebook.

Claassen said the slanderous comments on a Facebook page of a group with more than 7600 members. It is also open to all.

I am Thandie Tracy, I was in a serious relationship with my ex guy for three good years.. One day we were in a dinner party, we had a little misunderstanding which lead to a Quarrel and he stood up and left me at the dinner party. I try to call him but he was not picking my calls so after that I contacted my brother and told him about it,my brother so much love me that he had to see him on my behalf,he told my brother that it is over between us.. Then I contacted a friend of mine that had this similar experience and she directed me to one of the spiritual diviner . At first I thought it was not going to be possible and I contacted her I was ask to come up with a little requirement,so I did what I was asked to do, after 3 days I was in my office when my ex guy called me and was asking me to forgive him and come back to him. I was very surprised it was like a dream to me, since then, we have been happily married with one lovely baby...i wish you the best of luck.. if you need help contact her +2783 432 1037 IN BENONI, GAUTENG SOUTH AFRICA

Open letter to Cde Zwelinzima Vavi 

                                 “By ye deeds, ye shall know them” Dialego 

Dear Nobhala of the working class I write this letter to you internally bleeding, time and again my heart bleeds when I see the material conditions faced by the black children of the working class at the University of the Witwatersrand and in the entire country. My understanding is that the hard conditions our parents face in the assembly line has now assimilated to us in our various spheres. Capitalists continue to make lives of poor black people and working class unpleasable; the black man is only subjected to hard labour, labour as Marx would argue has now become a new phenomenon of slavery for our parents, even young black graduates are coerced systematically to work conscientiously for the benefit of white monopoly capital. 

I know you probably asking yourself why I am raising issues through the lenses of colour, for you never declared yourself a Pan-Africanist or a nationalist for that matter. But I am raising this based on colour, because reality is that everything in our country revolves politics and race. Off course I also blame Colonialism of the Special type and separate developments for the plight faced by the black man today. I do not only end there, I also blame and condemn your distractors highly, because they are leading the working class into a wilderness, they have allowed factional politics to be their desire, while they neglect their Marxist-Leninist tools of analysis (I wonder if they ever applied them before). I believe that it does not take a Pan-Africanist to see that black people are struggling, the material conditions faced by many of us, dictate that we become conscious of the struggle of black students, black middle class, black working class and poor black people. 

Nobhala, a lot has been said about you, I have been one of those who have insulted you countlessly, I was a pioneer of smear campaigns that manifested themselves in labels such “Vavism”. I gained nothing from such campaigns, instead the masses continue to view you as one of the most leaders we have. They said you sold the old Cosatu House building, I keep asking myself how on earth can one individual sign all documents prescribed to sell and purchase a building. Were you a god, in the 9th floor, Nobhala? I do not think so.

 It is through smear campaigns that your distractors have diluted the revolution; they are making the progressive trade union federation cheerleaders of the African National Congress. If you critique the ANC, you are out! We saw this venomous, malice tendency with Julius Malema, Floyd Shivambu, NUMSA leadership; the SACP have labelled the leadership of NUMSA, as “NUMSA leadership clique” I will stick to NUMSA and we also saw this with your expulsion from COSATU. One must ask who is next? The expulsion of NUMSA still holds no revolutionary basis, it is based on emotions, how on earth can a trade union federation expel the exploited workers? They then continued to replace NUMSA with a trade union that has leadership but never went to an elective congress. I keep asking myself that, if NUMSA was counter-revolutionary why does it still have many members? The workers are not stupid, they would have called a special congress (as always) and replace the current leadership, many of them would have joined the new trade union. 

Right syndicalism is in its highest peak to destroy our trade unions and its federation. The rue of oligarchy has replaced democratic centralism; our great movements have been transformed to be like monarch-if you dare criticise leadership, we will deal with you. Karl Marx in Das Kapital (Vol 1) was indeed correct when he attested about the objectives of the capitalists, to keep the workplace in which the essential business going on is the exploitation of labor with "No admittance except on business", our revolutionary COSATU is slowly assimilating the "hidden abode of production, on whose threshold there stares us in the face"-Don’t you dare criticize the ANC! This leads to what I have termed as “double exploitation” it means the workers are exploited by capitalists and also by trade union leaders who have a tendency of putting their hands in empty pockets of workers and take their last penny. 

Nobhala, what pains me most, is that COSATU was nowhere to be seen when children of the working class and the poor were rejected by NSFAS at Wits and Tshwane University of Technology. Students were told there is no money, but the Minister of Finance, Nhlanhla Nene had awarded close to R26 Billion to Eskom, I do not know how this money assisted, because even today black townships still suffer a lot from load-shedding. I reside in a student residence close to Haughton; I do not recall any day were we suffered from load shedding! Even when the Wits SRC led by Cde Mcebo Dlamini fundraised for us, I did not hear of any cent coming from COSATU coffers. Nobhala, at Wits lectures halls during the day they are centers of teaching and learning but at night they become bedroom to students who did not receive funding for accommodation, most of them feed on dustbins at night in order to survive hunger. Poverty is painful, young black people are angry, angry people are dangerous. I keep asking myself where is the Vanguard Party and COSATU to assist my fellow students who are struggling. 

There is a lot I wanted to address in this letter, but my conclusion is simple, you started burning the flame of our revolution, you made it clear that we must not mourn but mobilize, in that spirit, I would like to urge you not to forget that the struggle of a black child still continues. As you throughout the whole country, many of us support you, talk to our parents, engage them, and remind them that the struggle is bigger than us. That our enemy is one; it is none other than, white supremacy that has been enhanced by white monopoly capital. 

Aluta Continua, Nobhala!

status_message:
There is a peroxided male who, since this scandal broke, has incorrectly targeted me and made me the focus of his attention. My boy (because you are younger than me and still wet behind the ears), let me tell you something. I have been around the block. I have also been threatened for the past 30 odd years but, I am still around. You have touched a raw nerve. You also seem to have unfettered access to my facebook page and emails …. Don’t focus on me. I’m only the messenger. Focus, instead, on the people of the Cape Flats who have been murdered and who have left families behind ……
 
ANC calls for JP’s head
 
The New Age
Vincent Cruywagen
Thursday, 30 April 2015
 
‘THE ANC will today call for mayoral member for safety and security, JP Smith to be dismissed amid allegations that gang members were hired as security guards on city development project sites.   
 
The ANC has planned to move a motion in today’s council meeting to get Smith censured and dismissed.
 
Leader of the opposition in the City of Cape Town Council, Tony Ehrenreich, said they would send a letter to the national police ministry asking for a comprehensive investigation into the links between the city mayor and organised crime in Cape Town.
 
The scandal relates to allegations that members of the notorious Hard Livings gang were employed as security guards by a company responsible for renovating flats in Manenberg.
 
It is also alleged the gang demanded protection money and threatened to derail the project if they were axed.    
 
The situation reached a boiling point in December when members of the Americans gang became aware. Skirmishes then apparently took place.
 
Earlier this month the mayoral committee member for human settlements Benedicta van Minnen confirmed an investigation was under way and action be taken once the outcome of the investigation had been confirmed.
 
 Ehrenreich said: “We will today propose a motion and dismissal of JP Smith. It is clear that Smith has been involved in this saga from an early stage and only sent the letter after legal advice for him to find a way to be exempt from inclusion in the events.
 
There is documented proof that the City had been aware of the fact that gang members were involved in the security arrangements. This clearly point out the City’s links to organised crime – a fact the mayor was made aware of’.

status_message: UPDATE: More than 100 arrested during Thembelihle raid http://bit.ly/1DXZKlK

The dictionary defines XENOPHOBIA as a noun... "an unreasonable fear or hatred of foreigners or strangers or of that which is foreign or strange."...and it is made up of the word "xeno" meaning strange or foreign and "phobia" meaning fear.. With this in mind how can the goings-on of recent weeks be defined a xenophobia?  South Africans are not afraid of the strangers or foreigners, they are carrying out acts of crime against them . As usual the govenrnment and the media have latched on to a convenient catch phrase and sugar coat the activities by chalking them up to xenophobia. Africa as a whole, and South Africa in particular,  has a history of tribal wars, faction fighting and crime.  That is what we are experiencing in South Africa...Tribal wars , faction fighting, and acts of crime. Just at the moment,  the soft target are foreigners. Lets stop using the silly word zenophobia and call it what it is CRIME, ASSAULT, MURDER, LOOTING, ROBBERY,THEFT, BATTERY, RAPE, BURGLARY etc.

I share King Zwelithini's sentiments on foreigners, our government needs to urgently address this escalating issue. Most of this guys entered illegally into the country via Swaziland, Mozambique and Lesotho borders due to corrupt officials and lax border security. That is not even a main issue, you must remember majority of this immigrants are from a war torn countries and are highly skilled rebels posing an extensive threat to our security in the country. Can you imagine how many of them have obtained weapon by illicit means, what will happen when they decide to go rampage?? 
With the current situation in Durban some has gone as far as issuing threats that we haven't seen anything as yet.......
i'm perplexed by lack of response, do we have surveillance around this most Nigerians, Somalians, Bangladeshis, Pakistanis that are in the country??
Do we realize that this can escalate to a civil unrest and become a fertile ground for terrorism
Enough is Enough, all illegal immigrants should be deported with no remorse, our resources cannot be misdirected and deployed on matters that will not benefit the citizens

Ours must always and everywhere be about closing ranks, attract all to the ANC, instead of repelling. Our task is bigger than all of us as individuals as we are about building a South Africa that is Non Racial, Non Sexist and Prosperous. As part of a Progressive Movement in Afrika and World Wide, we have a mission of building a better world. Since the 1994 democratic breakthrough, what we need to understand is that, Apartheid Colonialism legacy remains with us in all manner of ways. Our Movement was born informed of a need to Unite in order to achieve all what we want to achieve. The old expression remains relevant as was in 1912 that United we Stand and Divided we Fall. When we are united, we have NOTHING to lose, BUT everything to gain. 

A call to ALL those that carried us in difficult times, in the 1950's, 1960's, 1970's and 1980's must be made, firstly, to say SORRY for having forgotten about you - the shopkeepers who would earn as little as R500.00 a day, our Poets, our progressive teachers, our Priests, our Women folk, our Media activists, our Doctors and Nurses, our Traditional Doctors, our Non Racial Sports People etc. 

To all those that got disgruntled for whatever reasons and left our Glorious Movement led by the ANC, the time to come back home is now.

Remember, Leaders come, Leaders go, BUT your ANC, MY ANC REMAINS, with a simple agenda of bettering the lives of our ordinary People and building a Non Racial, Non Sexist and Prosperous SA. Lulu Johnson, MP in my personal capacity as an ordinary member of the ANC.

Hi my name is John Lourens 0812677593 johnlourens5274@gmail.com
I live on a small farm Pretoria East Tierpoot and I have been in an on going battle with Eskom over my close to 100 indigenous trees!

My trees ly on a servitude part of the farm and they are home to game and birds ! Bush baby's, hornbills ,bush buck and wild cats ! Hedgehogs and various other natural occurring fauna!

I have left the area in peace protecting it from poaching and interferences !
Some trees are over 80 to ninety years old and magnificent some on the protection list ! 
In the past due to the up keep and maintenance of the line I have allowed that the trees be trimmed to with in the legal clearance ! With no problems and they get done every year !

Now over the last year I have been involved in the battle as they have instructed me that the trees are illegal and that the whole lot need to be removed ! Which is strange as the trees have been there longer than the existences of Eskom has !
I have had many a meeting where I have been bullied by numerous different officials !
The Last couple of days have been hell I got an email on the Thursday of this last week at 16 .13 that they offer me 5 transplant trees to the values of not exceeding R 50 000.00 rand !
But that I had till close of business that day to give my answers or they where going to the high court to obtain a court order against me with cost against me ! I replied that I could not respond in such short time as I needed to seek council ! They tried Friday again and I told them Monday coming !

In the months prior they got me to as I asked to have the trees moved !! Get a specialist in in the job of moving trees to give a quote and evaluation! 
Which I did and sent on the quote !
They then asked me to ascertain the value of the trees ! Which I did and forwarded !
I would like to state I made it clear in all meetings and correspondence that I am not at all interested in compensation for the trees but want them trimmed as in past years or moved !

Saturday yesterday I got a summons that asks the court to make urgent application to gain access to my property to remove all my trees and that the Saps a company them and use reasonable force against me ! Oh and I pay all there costs !! 1!!
I have to give notice by 13h 00 on monday the 16 March of my intention to defend and go to court Tuesday !
I have no representation and it's only me !
I need to do this for my trees and the animals that make it there home !

Please help me! 
Please like and share to every one!
And every organisations that can help !

Shared by Gina Borrett

IFP: CALLS FOR RE-TRAINING OF ALL FRONTLINE STAFF AT HEALTH FACILITIES

The IFP in KwaZulu-Natal calls on the MEC of Health, Dr Sibongiseni Dhlomo to make it mandatory that all frontline staff be retrained on proper customer care after reports that patients are being turned away at some healthcare facilities.

"Nandi Clinic in Stanger is one example of such a healthcare facility where patients are being turned away by nurses and of nurses treating patients with little or no respect. I conducted an unannounced oversight visit to this clinic where the patients told me that nurses are not treating them well. My oversight
 visit came after I received serious complaints from concerned community members about bad treatment they received at Nandi Clinic. This is unacceptable and calls for immediate intervention by the MEC," said IFP Spokesperson on Health, Mrs Ncamisile Nkwanyana, MPL.

"The right of all citizens to receive quality treatment in public healthcare facilities is specifically guaranteed by our constitution. No one deserves to be treated in an inhumane manner especially by medical personnel who took an oath to serve those who are ill. People go to these public health care facilities because they are in need of medical help from people who are paid from tax payer's money. Nurses with bad attitudes towards patients must be removed from the health profession as their conduct is unacceptable," continued Mrs Nkwanyana.

"Government cannot hope to achieve its goals in terms of the National Health Insurance while such conditions prevail at our public health care facilities. The MEC, HOD and other senior managers are urged to conduct unannounced visits without any fanfare to get a clear picture of what goes on and not be fooled by
 the airbrushed reports that they get from some facilities when they visit with delegations," concluded Mrs Nkwanyana.

The IFP demands that the MEC must develop a roadmap, which provides a strategic long-term framework for government in terms of human resource development, health facility upgrading and the establishment of specialised services and institutions.

ENDS

Issued by:
 Mrs Ncamisile Nkwanyana MPL, IFP Spokesperson on Health,

INKATHA FREEDOM PARTY*

RESPONSE TO THE 2015 KWAZULU-NATAL STATE OF THE PROVINCE ADDRESS BY: HONOURABLE BLESSED GWALA MPL

TUESDAY, 03 MARCH 2015
 Venue: KZN Legislature

Thanks Premier for the State of the Province address:

Hon Speaker, I want to commence by reminding the Hon Premier of what he said when he took office in May 2014, he said:

"I want to assure the Judge, President and the people of KwaZulu-Natal in general that as elected representatives of the aspirations of millions of our people, we will cast our eyes into the future with a clear understanding that failure is not an option"

Today I rise to say to the Hon Premier that you and your executive have closed your eyes and failed the millions of our people in KwaZulu-Natal.

Hon Speaker, the Inkatha Freedom Party was expecting the Hon Premier to set the mind of His Majesty at ease regarding the Royal Household Trust and its sustainability. The Premier should have informed this House as to why his government took a decision to disestablish the Department of the Royal Household without consultation with other political parties. When the future of this
 Department was discussed, it was agreed that the Department will be disbanded only after all political parties are satisfied that the Royal Household Trust will be able to sustain itself and manage its affairs in the interest of His Majesty and the Royal family. Since His Majesty was present at SOPA, it would have been appropriate for the Hon Premier to explain why this decision was taken in such a clandestine manner. In this regard the Premier has failed His Majesty and the Royal Family.

I would like to remind the Hon Premier that in his address in this House last year, His Majesty instructed MEC Xaba to fast track the programme "ukubiywa kwamasimu" but this programme has not even started in Ngwavuma and Nongoma. Here again you have failed, Hon Premier.

It is good that the Hon Premier mentioned his concerns around increasing criminal activity in the province. Here again the Premier has failed the law abiding citizens of KZN. Hon Speaker, how can this Premier expect to curb crime and ensure the safety of our citizens when the Provincial Commissioner, Mmamonnye Ngobeni has a dark cloud hanging over her head. For a long time the
 IFP has raised its concern about the credibility and suitability of Ngobeni to head crime fighting in KZN. I must commend the Independent Police Investigation Directorate (IPID) for its report and now the police are carrying out investigations under Section

12 which deals with serious misconduct against the Commissioner, a Colonel and a Captain all on related charges of corruption. We want to see that an advocate with a clean track record be at the head of the disciplinary hearings. How can
 police personnel feel inspired and be motivated when their provincial commissioner is under investigation? How can the KZN community feel safe when the police has such dubious personnel sitting in high offices? But even though we advised the Premier not to renew her contract when it expired last year while these allegations were hanging over her head, her contract was renewed on recommendation from this executive to the National Police Commissioner. Is the Hon Premier serious about reducing crime? Just this past week a 71 year old couple, Susanna and Melvin Lawson were murdered at Oribi Village just up the road from where we are, Hluhluwe farmer, Terrence Rizzato was gunned down, a well-known Estcourt farmer Malcolm 'Stick' Green was also killed and the list goes on to include rapes, burglaries, hijackings and robberies. In this regard the Premier has failed every law abiding citizen in KZN. The IFP sends its condolences to all those who have lost loved ones due to the broken promises of
 this Executive.

Hon Speaker, this Executive closed their eyes and failed the thousands of learners across our province. Let me remind the Premier that speaking about education during his Inauguration in May 2014 he said: "We want to ensure an improvement in our matric results from the previous term of office"

But what did the Premier do - he appointed a MEC that stumbles from one disaster to another. How can we consider the drop in the matric pass rate from 77.4% in 2013 to 69.7% last year "an improvement"? It is a disaster! How can we consider the "mass copying" uncovered by Umalusi "an improvement"? It is a disaster and a disgrace! Unfortunately this MEC will consider it "a good story to tell" while our children's lives are being destroyed. Here again you have failed our people.

The Premier mentioned that far too many of our school children are being killed or injured while being transported in bakkies but he does not provide a solution to the challenge of scholar transport. How many of our children must still die before this government will apply its mind and come up with a workable solution? Again the Premier has failed.

Let me also remind the Premier what he said about health care:
 "During this term of office we will move with speed towards the introduction of the National Health Insurance system. There is no turning back"

How can you turn back when you are lying flat on your face with no sense of direction? The implementation of the NHI seems a distant dream while conditions at our public health care facilities deteriorate. When my colleague in the IFP, the Hon Nkwanyana goes on oversight visits to hospitals to see how she can assist, not only patients but also staff, the MEC for Health gets hot under the
 collar and wants to complain to the Speaker. Complain about what? This Hon Member is doing what every Hon Member in this House should be doing and that is to conduct oversight and inform the MEC about any shortcomings. Is MEC Dhlomo ashamed of what is going on at some hospitals that he wants to prevent MPLs from doing their jobs?

Madame Speaker, allow me to remind Hon Members what the Hon Premier said at SOPA last week:

"We acknowledge and respect the oversight role of this House as set out in the Constitution"

Whilst the Hon Premier acknowledges and encourages MPLs to perform oversight, the MEC for Health is against this.

Our public hospital infrastructure is crumbling, there is a shortage of doctors and nurses are resigning in droves afraid that they will not get their pension fund money when they retire. There is a shortage of medicines even at the Inkosi Albert Luthuli Memorial Hospital which is supposed to be the flagship health care facility of our province and a model for the country so much so that the
 NGO, the Gift of the Givers had to come to the rescue of the Department of Health by donating the required medicines. I take this opportunity to thank the Gift of the Givers for its humanitarian work nationally and internationally. Here again, Hon Premier your Cabinet is failing our people.

Speaking at the Provincial Lekgotla two weeks ago the Hon Premier said: "There is corruption in government. I no longer doubt that particular issue." It is wonderful that there was that admission but the Premier in his address did not convince the people of this province that he has a strategy on how to tackle the corruption that exists across all spheres of government. Whilst you identified supply chain management as an area where corruption exists, you must admit that there are many other areas of government where corruption is rife. By not outlining a clear, workable strategy, Hon Premier you are failing our people.

Allow me to remind the Premier that President Zuma had called for an investigation into the abuse of tax payers' money on projects like the International North Sea Jazz Festival, Commemorating Prisoners of War - St Helena event and the KwaZulu-Natal Sharks Board. Millions of Rands were paid to the organisers but the project never took place and money was not recovered that
 saw this province losing millions of rand. I was expecting the Premier to heed this call and report on the outcome of the investigation in the SOPA. But here again you have failed not only this House but President Zuma himself.

I will give credit where it is due and therefore I must commend the
 identification of teachers who have been using fraudulent certificates to gain promotions and increased salaries. These people must be charged and if found guilty they must be dismissed and blacklisted from working in any government
 department. The investigations must be ongoing and must be intensified to root out fraud and corruption even among officials in all departments.

Hon Speaker, I would have expected the Premier to say something about the recent reports that KZN spent more than R5billion on consultants

- the highest in the country. The Department of Health itself spent R1.8billion on consultants. As the IFP we are convinced that such excessive use of consultants can only be attributed to the ANC's policy of cadre deployment that sees unqualified, inexperienced and incompetent card-carrying members being deployed into positions that they are not fit to occupy. If the Hon Premier is
 serious about rooting out corruption, he has to pronounce on this issue because such deployments are also examples of corrupt practices.

We are aware of the turmoil that exists at Ezemvelo KZN Wildlife and the unhappiness among the staff. The HOD has been suspended but no charges have been preferred against him. This entity plays such a vital role in conservation and is recognised internationally, but the Premier failed to mention anything about
 this. Could it be that this government wants to shut down this entity or have it taken over by National Parks?

The Premier has failed to inform this House why the proposed Drakensberg Cable Way is set to go ahead even though the Environment Impact Assessment has not been completed and the local community has not been taken on board. Could it be
 that someone has been paid off already to ensure that the project goes ahead?

The same question could be asked with regard to the proposed Dug Out Port south of Durban. Even though international experts advise that more use should be made of the existing Durban harbour there is talk to continue with this ambitious and
 ill-advised project.

The Premier also failed to mention the much talked about Business Train between Durban and Pietermaritzburg. Why is this service not up and running after millions of rand has been invested in this project?

The Premier rightfully paid tribute to the late Senzo Meyiwa but seems to have forgotten his pledge of naming a stadium or sports academy in memory of our football hero. Was that commitment just another nice thing to say at the time with no intention of fulfilling it? Whilst on this issue I must raise our concern about the huge expenditure incurred during state funerals where service
 providers and even some officials end up fleecing government. This is something that the Premier must seriously consider going forward.

In reference to the economy and job creation, the Hon Premier said: "We are experiencing a situation where the private sector seems reluctant to invest in the local economy"

It is encouraging that the Premier acknowledges this challenge. I would advise the Cabinet to take heed of the comments and suggestions made by the private sector at the Executive Retreat held in November last year.

It is also good to note that many times during the SOPA the Premier referred to the erratic power supply as a "crisis" but unfortunately the President of the country who is also President of the ANC has said that it is not a crisis. With this kind of confused leadership, it is no wonder that investor confidence is dwindling.

But on a more positive note it is encouraging to note that the Samsung Manufacturing Plant and the Keystone Light Industrial and Logistics Park are on track as these initiatives will go a long way to create sustainable jobs.

Hon Speaker, in his address the Hon Premier acknowledged many serious challenges that face us as a province and I thank him for his honesty in this regard, but he fell short of convincing our citizens that he has strategies in place to address these challenges. Let me mention some of them

1. With regard to people living below the poverty line of R318 per month, this government had set itself a target to reduce the number to 18%, but in fact the number rose from 25% to 28%. Here again the Premier failed to say how this government intends to turn this around.

2. Regarding social inequality, this government had a target of 19.4% but it has remained at 17.6% between 2010 and 2014. Here again the Premier has failed.

3. The Hon Premier reported: "a woman is killed every 6 hours by her partner". This is a tragic but factual revelation but there was no assurance coming from the SOPA that our women will be safe going forward. Here again the Premier has failed.

4. Weaknesses in local government management are leading to numerous, often violent and destructive, service delivery protests, but SOPA provided no strategy to strengthen local government management. Again the Premier has failed.

5. For many years now we have been hearing of more international airlines landing at King Shaka International Airport but apart from Emirates no other international carrier has come forward but SOPA has not provided an explanation or any progress. Here again the Premier has failed.

ENDS

Contact: Mr Blessed Gwala, IFP Leader in the KZN Legislature,

IFP: MEC MUST TAKE ACTION AGAINST IMBAMBAZANE MAYOR

The IFP in KwaZulu-Natal calls on the MEC of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs Nomusa Dube-Ncube to urgently take action against the Imbabazane Mayor, Phindile Strydom whose car was yet again involved in an accident.

"On Friday the mayor's driver, driving a white Toyota Fortuner smashed into a stationary Chevrolet in the parking lot. The mayor was in the Toyota dressed in her ANC attire when the accident occurred. After both the mayor and her driver checked the damage, the mayor instructed her driver to leave the scene without
 reporting the matter to the police. Assisted by community members, traffic officers were able to trace the mayor and her driver. This a blatant disregard of the law and must be viewed as a criminal offence," said IFP Leader in the KZN Legislature, Mr Blessed Gwala, MPL.

"The owner of the damaged car contacted the mayor and her driver at the Imbabazane offices and they requested that the matter should be settled out of court. This new Fortuner is being used by the mayor after her previous vehicle which cost the municipality about R3million was written off when she was not in the vehicle near Mooi River. It would appear that the mayor and her body guards have taken a conscious decision to destroy council vehicles and show a total
 disregard for the rule of law. In failing to act decisively against the mayor, the MEC is failing the people of Imbabazane," continued Mr Gwala.

"We want to see the MEC taking action against the mayor and her bodyguards. We are aware that if it was an IFP mayor, the ANC in Imbabazane, MEC and the ANC provincial leadership would have been very vocal in calling for the removal of the mayor, but because it's an ANC mayor they are turning a blind eye. We demand that the MEC shows leadership and acts in this matter," concluded Mr Gwala.

The IFP calls for the urgent removal of Imbabazane Mayor, Phindile Strydom along with her driver and bodyguards.

ENDS

Issued by: 
 Mr Blessed Gwala, IFP Leader in the KZN Legislature
